00051 #ifndef EIO_H
00052 #define EIO_H
00053 
00054 #include <stdio.h>
00055 #include "thread.h"
00056 
00057 /* EIO file formats */
00058 #define EIO_X86_FORMAT      2  /* mind you, this is what EIO_ALPHA_FORMAT was also originally defined to */
00059 /* EIO file version */
00060 #define EIO_FILE_VERSION                4
00061 
00062 FILE *eio_create(struct thread_t * core, char *fname);
00063 
00064 FILE *eio_open(char *fname);
00065 
00066 /* returns non-zero if file FNAME has a valid EIO header */
00067 int eio_valid(char *fname);
00068 
00069 void eio_close(FILE *fd);
00070 
00071 /* check point current architected state to stream FD, returns
00072    EIO transaction count (an EIO file pointer) */
00073 counter_t
00074 eio_write_chkpt(struct thread_t *core, FILE *fd);                       /* stream to write to */
00075 
00076 /* read check point of architected state from stream FD, returns
00077    EIO transaction count (an EIO file pointer) */
00078 counter_t
00079 eio_read_chkpt(struct thread_t *core, FILE *fd);                        /* stream to read */
00080 
00081 /* syscall proxy handler, with EIO tracing support, architect registers
00082    and memory are assumed to be precise when this function is called,
00083    register and memory are updated with the results of the sustem call */
00084 void
00085 eio_write_trace(
00086     struct thread_t * core,
00087     FILE *eio_fd,                       /* EIO stream file desc */
00088                 mem_access_fn mem_fn,           /* generic memory accessor */
00089                 md_inst_t inst);                /* system call inst */
00090 
00091 /* syscall proxy handler from an EIO trace, architect registers
00092    and memory are assumed to be precise when this function is called,
00093    register and memory are updated with the results of the sustem call */
00094 #ifdef __cplusplus
00095 extern "C" {
00096 #endif
00097 void
00098 eio_read_trace(
00099          struct thread_t * core,
00100          FILE *eio_fd,                  /* EIO stream file desc */
00101                mem_access_fn mem_fn,            /* generic memory accessor */
00102                md_inst_t inst);                 /* system call inst */
00103 #ifdef __cplusplus
00104 }
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 /* fast forward EIO trace EIO_FD to the transaction just after ICNT */
00108 void eio_fast_forward(struct thread_t * core, FILE *eio_fd, counter_t icnt);
00109 
00110 #endif /* EIO_H */
